name: SPISC-VET-001
task_description:
Age Verification (60+ Years)

Verify that the applicant meets the minimum age requirement for Social Pension eligibility:

  • Check applicant's date of birth against government-issued ID
  • Calculate current age - must be 60 years or older
  • Verify ID document authenticity (birth certificate, senior citizen ID, passport)
  • Note the date of birth and ID type in the assessment record

If under 60: Application must be declined - age requirement is mandatory.

Applicant: {{doc.applicant_name}} | Application: {{doc.name}}

name: SPISC-VET-002
task_description:
Residency Verification

Confirm the applicant is a resident of the municipality:

  • Review proof of residence documents (utility bill, barangay certificate, voter registration)
  • Verify address matches municipality jurisdiction
  • Check minimum residency duration requirements (if applicable)
  • Confirm applicant is not receiving pension from another municipality

Required Documents: Barangay Certificate of Residency, proof of address

If non-resident: Decline application and advise to apply to resident municipality.

name: SPISC-VET-003
task_description:
Existing Benefits Check

Verify the applicant is not currently receiving similar pension benefits:

  • Check municipal pension database for existing records
  • Query SSS/GSIS databases for government pension receipt
  • Verify applicant declaration of other income sources
  • Check with barangay for knowledge of other benefits

Note: SPISC is for indigent seniors without other pension support.

If receiving other pension: Application may need to be declined or amount adjusted based on policy.

name: SPISC-TA-001
task_description:
Income Assessment

Assess the applicant's monthly income against the indigency threshold:

  • Review income documentation (payslips, remittances, rental income)
  • Calculate total monthly household income
  • Verify income is below municipal poverty threshold
  • Check consistency with ITR or tax records (if available)
  • Note any irregular or seasonal income sources

Income Threshold: {{threshold_amount}} per month

If above threshold: Application must be declined - does not meet indigency criteria.

name: SPISC-TA-002
task_description:
Household Assessment

Evaluate the applicant's household situation and support network:

  • Review household composition form - number of dependents, working members
  • Assess family support availability and capacity
  • Check living situation (alone, with family, institutionalized)
  • Verify children's employment status and income (if applicable)
  • Note any special circumstances (disability, illness, sole caregiver)

Purpose: Determine actual level of need and prioritization.

name: SPISC-TA-003
task_description:
Document Verification

Review and verify all required supporting documents:

  • Identity Documents: Birth certificate, Senior Citizen ID, Valid ID
  • Proof of Residence: Barangay Certificate, Utility bills
  • Income Proof: ITR, Certificate of No Income, Affidavits
  • Photos: Recent passport-sized photos
  • Other: Any additional documents (medical certificates, etc.)

Check for: Authenticity, completeness, validity dates, clear photocopies

If missing documents: Contact applicant for submission before proceeding.

name: SPISC-TA-004
task_description:
Home Visit Assessment

For cases requiring validation, conduct a home visit to verify living conditions:

  • Coordinate with barangay officials for accompaniment
  • Verify applicant's residential address and living conditions
  • Assess actual poverty level through observation
  • Interview family members (if present) about support capacity
  • Take photos for case file (with consent)
  • Prepare home visit report with findings and recommendation

Note: Required for applications where documentation is insufficient or concerns exist.

Safety: Always conduct in pairs and coordinate with barangay.

name: SPISC-DEC-001
task_description:
Final Assessment Review

Review all vetting and technical assessment findings to make eligibility determination:

  • Confirm all vetting checks passed (age, residency, no duplicate benefits)
  • Review income assessment results - below threshold?
  • Assess household situation and level of need
  • Verify all required documents are authentic and complete
  • Review home visit report (if conducted)
  • Check for any red flags or inconsistencies

Outcome: Prepare preliminary eligibility recommendation (Approve/Decline/More Info Needed)

name: SPISC-DEC-002
task_description:
Decision Memorandum Preparation

Prepare formal decision memo documenting the eligibility determination:

  • Summarize applicant details and application date
  • Document all assessment findings (vetting, technical, home visit)
  • State eligibility criteria assessment results
  • Provide clear recommendation with justification
  • Note any special considerations or conditions
  • Attach supporting documents and evidence

Format: Use standard SPISC Decision Memo template

For Approval: {{approver_name}} - {{approver_title}}

name: SPISC-DEC-003
task_description:
Final Approval Process

Obtain required approvals for the pension grant:

  • Submit decision memo to Municipal Social Welfare Officer
  • Present case to approval committee (if required)
  • Obtain signature on approval document
  • Update application status in system
  • File approved decision in permanent records

Approval Authority: Municipal Social Welfare and Development Officer / Mayor

Timeline: Allow 5 working days for approval process

If declined: Prepare decline letter with specific reasons and appeal rights.

name: SPISC-IMP-001
task_description:
Payment Setup

Set up the approved beneficiary in the pension payment system:

  • Gather bank account details or preferred payment method (cash pickup, bank transfer, card)
  • Verify account ownership matches beneficiary
  • Create beneficiary profile in payment system
  • Configure monthly payment amount and schedule
  • Set up payment start date (typically 1st of following month)
  • Assign unique beneficiary ID number

Payment Amount: {{monthly_pension_amount}}

Frequency: Monthly (every 1st or 15th per policy)

name: SPISC-IMP-002
task_description:
Beneficiary Notification

Notify the approved beneficiary of their pension approval:

  • Prepare approval letter with beneficiary ID and payment details
  • Include payment schedule and first payment date
  • Explain beneficiary obligations (quarterly recertification, report changes)
  • Provide contact details for pension inquiries
  • Schedule orientation session for new beneficiaries (if required)
  • Send letter via registered mail or arrange personal pickup
  • Update barangay for their records

Template: Use SPISC Approval Notification template

Include: Beneficiary ID card, payment schedule, orientation invite
